question: Who composed 'The Four Seasons'?
funFact: Antonio Vivaldi composed 'The Four Seasons' (Le quattro stagioni) around 1720, one of the most famous works in classical music, consisting of four violin concertos.

question: Who composed 'Für Elise'?
funFact: Ludwig van Beethoven composed 'Für Elise' (For Elise) around 1810. It's one of his most popular piano pieces, though the identity of 'Elise' remains a mystery.

question: Who wrote the opera 'The Magic Flute'?
funFact: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart wrote 'The Magic Flute' (Die Zauberflöte) in 1791, one of his most famous operas, combining comedy, drama, and beautiful music.

question: Who composed 'The Well-Tempered Clavier'?
funFact: Johann Sebastian Bach composed 'The Well-Tempered Clavier,' a collection of preludes and fugues in all 24 major and minor keys, completed in 1722 and 1742.

question: Who composed 'The Nutcracker'?
funFact: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky composed 'The Nutcracker' ballet in 1892, which has become one of the most popular ballets, especially during the Christmas season.

question: Who composed 'Canon in D'?
funFact: Johann Pachelbel composed 'Canon in D' around 1680. Though not well-known during his lifetime, it has become one of the most recognizable pieces of classical music.

question: Who composed 'The Ring of the Nibelung'?
funFact: Richard Wagner composed 'The Ring of the Nibelung,' a cycle of four epic operas based on Norse mythology, taking over 26 years to complete (1848-1874).

question: Who composed 'Clair de Lune'?
funFact: Claude Debussy composed 'Clair de Lune' (Moonlight) in 1890, part of his 'Suite Bergamasque.' It's one of the most popular impressionist piano pieces.

question: Who composed 'Eine kleine Nachtmusik'?
funFact: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart composed 'Eine kleine Nachtmusik' (A Little Night Music) in 1787. It's one of his most famous serenades.

question: Who composed 'The Rite of Spring'?
funFact: Igor Stravinsky composed 'The Rite of Spring' in 1913. Its premiere caused a riot due to its revolutionary music and choreography, but it's now considered a masterpiece.
